techmeme.title: Faulty court filing redactions show TikTok executives were unconcerned with the harms the app poses for teenagers despite internal research validating concerns (NPR)
Sources: Salt Typhoon hackers still had access to some parts of US broadband networks within the last week, and investigators don't know what they were seeking (Wall Street Journal)
Filing: TikTok's European revenue grew to $4.57B in 2023, up from $2.6B in 2022; losses grew to $1.3B, up from $512M YoY; ByteDance set aside $1B for EU fines (Iain Martin/Forbes)
CoreWeave says it has a new $650M credit line and has raised $12.7B from equity and debt investors in the past 18 months (Hayden Field/CNBC)
Some developers say OpenAI's GPT Store is a mixed bag, with revenue sharing reserved for a tiny number of GPT creators in an invite-only pilot program in the US (Lauren Goode/Wired)
